p: Coronaviruses that are closely related to SARS‐CoV are typically found in bats (Li et al. 2005). There is evidence that SARS‐CoV originated in bats in China and reached humans most probably after jumping to an intermediate host, the civet ( Paguma larvata) (reviewed by Wang and Eaton 2007). Similarly, MERS‐CoV is endemic in dromedary camels in the Middle East, from which it can be transmitted to humans, but it may also have originated in bats (Cui et al. 2019). The MERS epidemic is ongoing, and as of December 2019, 2468 cases have been reported (Baharoon and Memish 2019) and the mortality rate has been as high as 42% (Mohd et al. 2016). At the other end of the virulence spectrum are coronavirus species that cause common colds in humans with relatively mild symptoms (reviewed by Su et al. 2016).
